comments.author: towo@towo.net
comments.text:
Bookmarks separators in SeaMonkey 2.0 (and Firefox 2.0) could have labels which are part of my bookmarks data that I want to maintain in new versions.

This nice feature was lost with 2.1 by integrating the terrible new bookmarks system of Firefox.

For a discussion of the issue, see Firefox bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=121053

Severity: this leads to dataloss for the users, so I consider it critical. Also, it would be really easy to fix, another argument for "critical" for a bug that annoys so many power users.
comments.creator: towo@towo.net
comments.raw_text:
Bookmarks separators in SeaMonkey 2.0 (and Firefox 2.0) could have labels which are part of my bookmarks data that I want to maintain in new versions.

This nice feature was lost with 2.1 by integrating the terrible new bookmarks system of Firefox.

Severity: this leads to dataloss for the users, so I consider it critical. Also, it would be really easy to fix, another argument for "critical" for a bug that annoys so many power users.

comments.text: See Firefox Bug 404983 - Separators don't have names/descriptions any longer.
comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com
